Pre-Game Insights: Belarus and Bulgaria will square off at the neutral ZTE Arena in Hungary, opening their respective 2024-25 UEFA Nations League campaigns.
Both nations aim to make a strong start in League C Group 3, where they will battle with Northern Ireland and Luxembourg.
Belarus have conceded an average of 1.4 goals per game in their last 10 international matches.
Bulgaria have drawn five of their last six games but failed to keep a clean sheet in any of them.
Max Ebong is Belarus’s top scorer in their squad with five international goals, while Bulgaria’s Kiril Despodov leads with 14 goals.
Belarus have failed to keep a clean sheet in their last four international fixtures, shipping four goals in two of those matches.
Bulgaria’s record of conceding 14 goals in eight Euro 2024 qualification matches speaks volumes.
Ilian Iliev’s side also failed to keep a clean sheet in their last six matches.
Belarus average 0.9 goals per game from their last 10 matches, with Bulgaria matching that statistic.
Bulgaria’s average of 10.5 shots per game indicates they will pressure Belarus’s defence throughout the match.
